reviews.review_msg: Right off the bat, she's not a set professor for SFU but a Ph.D. student in her final year that just teaches marketing. That being said, she is incredibly passionate about the topic and makes an effort to ensure understanding by every single student. She makes an active effort to know students by name and is readily and responsive to queries
Emily's classes are always fun. Sometimes her logic is hard to follow because it is not always organized but I still enjoyed the course!
For the first time I can't name a single flaw in a  prof. Incredibly thorough, caring, patient and engaging. I highly doubt anyone can replace her as my favourite prof.
I love her energy!  The contest is meh but there is nothing she can do about that. I hope she teaches more courses.
Emily is so energetic! I am having fun in 341, even though I don't like marketing.

BUS 341 is not an easy course by any means because there's a lot of material to cover when it comes to exam time. The Professor, Emily, is what makes this course fun and interesting. Her interest towards the subject and her attitude towards students is unparalleled. An extremely unselfish person who places students at her #1 spot. Thank You Emily!!

No idea why her ratings are so harsh she's cool. Lectures were straight forward and you always got lots of time to work on everything. i had two lectures back to back with her, 2 hours each, but they never felt to drag on. Only thing i would say is she grades kinda tough on the weekly assignments but its the same for everyone so. Totally recommend.

Amazing lecturer, very lively, kind, and humble. This is a Marketing class for Business Minor, and the knowledge gained in her class is very useful in business or starting your own business. Don't mind the bad reviews here; they are unfair. Luana is on par with the best Business profs in SFU that has/nearly 5-star ratings here. She deserves 5 stars

I really enjoyed the marketing class, although it was a lot of work. Content is applicable to all careers. Jeanette is very knowledgeable, related the content to practice and kept the class engaged. You choose your own group project to carry through which is fun and means applying what you learn to a real-life example.

Midterms are 100 MC/TF Q's with ~80 minutes. Some questions are cumulative although he states otherwise. Debates IMO are redundant and can be heavily one-sided. I don't understand the lecture format, 3 hours of reading off the slides -- no one paid attention in class. Also don't understand having the class mark your debate/presentations.
His lectures usually took more than 4 hours. When it comes to debate and presentation, he has no grading criteria and leave you to guess. He is the worst prof I ever met.

Never take it with this guy. He is the most boring person on the planet. He hold weekly debates and presentation which is nice but he makes other students from class grade the presentations and debate and this course is graded on a curve. So people you are competing with are grading you. He also never replies to emails. I

The worst business class I have ever taken. Grades did not come back until the end of the semester, the material was bland as well as repetitive, and the professor was unresponsive to emails or inquiries (including when a midterm exam blocked the students from accessing it).

Michael is very funny and seems like a great guy. However, he's not the best prof, for this class he literally read from the textbook for 4 hours. He grades you on a solo presentation/short paper but gives 0 guidance and specificity for the grading criteria. Tests are multiple choice but can be tricky due to wording.
amazing prof !! provides relevant feedback and helps you throughout the course. Interesting lectures and exams are fair if you read the textbook and pay attention in class.
